definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: Moving my exercise has also allowed me to simplify the morning routine.
sentences.chinese: 把晨練取消也可以簡化我的清晨功課。

sentences.english: The best way to improve your concentration all day long is by exercising first thing in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 每天晨練是幫助你提升專注力最好的辦法。

sentences.english: Robin hunter prepares to take a morning dip in the freezing waters of the Serpentine Lido in Hyde Park on November 30, 2010 in London, United Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 獵人準備着跳進冰凍的倫敦海德公園的湖水中晨練。

sentences.english: Do morningexercises for half an hour or forty minutes every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天進行半小時或四十分鐘晨練吧。

sentences.english: I complete a simple daily 7-minute morning routine that I recommend.
sentences.chinese: 我完整的列出了簡單的每天7分鐘晨練計劃。

sentences.english: But it's also not fine if having breakfast just before morning exercises.
sentences.chinese: 但也不應喫完早餐立即外出晨練。

sentences.english: Morning exercises are one of my first steps to the balance in me.
sentences.chinese: 晨練是我用來平衡我自己所踏出的第一步。

sentences.english: Stay up late for a night out, get up early to make a morning train.
sentences.chinese: 晚上出去玩到很晚，早晨早起做晨練。

definition: matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
to preserve and nurture one's spirit (idiom); honing one's strength for the big push
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
to wake up from a sleep
to drip with sweat/sweat poured off (him)
